intro: Gunniopsis propinqua, commonly known as the slender gunniopsis, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically found in regions of Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas, where it thrives in full sun. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in a cluster, and it produces achenes as its seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
